definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: And tongues to be, your being shall rehearse.
sentences.chinese: 未来的舌头也会将你永传诵。

sentences.english: Heart, already sit under the bodhi tree, a lotus, be calm and empty.
sentences.chinese: 心，已经坐在菩提树下，一羽莲花，传诵淡定的空寂。

sentences.english: There’s drum poetry, actually language on drums, that is recited — the history of the king, and so forth.
sentences.chinese: 有鼓诗，实际是鼓的语言，传诵国王的历史等等。

sentences.english: Long will the legend be told, and forever will his name be remembered.
sentences.chinese: 传说会被永世传诵，他的名字也会永远被铭记。

definition: understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
a good reputation to last down the generations
